IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO BRING THE PLEASURE, POWER AND RELEVANCE OF CLASSIC THEATER TO THE WIDEST POSSIBLE AUDIENCE THROUGH ITS MAIN STAGE AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH PRODUCTIONS AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO BRING THE PLEASURE, POWER AND RELEVANCE OF CLASSIC THEATER TO THE WIDEST POSSIBLE AUDIENCE THROUGH ITS MAIN STAGE AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH PRODUCTIONS AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS.
IRS990.Desc: GREAT LAKES THEATER (GLT) PRODUCES PLAYS OF WILLIAM SHAKESPEARE AND OTHER CLASSICAL PLAYWRIGHTS. DURING THE 2021-2022 SEASON, FOUR PLAYS WERE PRESENTED TO THE COMMUNITY, TWO FEWER THAN IN A NORMAL FISCAL YEAR DUE TO THE CORONAVIRUS PANDEMIC. PLAYS PRESENTED INCLUDED "THE TEMPEST", "A CHRISTMAS CAROL", "MUCH ADO ABOUT NOTHING", AND "THE 39 STEPS". A PRODUCTION OF "AIN'T MISBEHAVIN'" WAS SCHEDULED BUT CANCELLED DUE TO COVID. RECEIPT OF A SHUTTERED VENUE OPERATORS GRANT AND PRIOR YEARS' PAYCHECK PROTECTION PROGRAM FUNDS ENABLED GLT TO CONTINUE TO EXPEND RESOURCES TO SUPPORT THE PRODUCTION DEPARTMENT. A TOTAL OF 22,532 ATTENDED THE PUBLIC PERFORMANCES. STUDENT MATINEE SERIES PERFORMANCES OF MAINSTAGE PRODUCTIONS SERVED AN ADDITIONAL 2,457 STUDENTS AT THE HANNA AND MIMI OHIO THEATERS, PLAYHOUSE SQUARE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: EDUCATION PROGRAMS: SCHOOL RESIDENCY PROGRAMMING (SPECIALLY TRAINED ACTOR-TEACHERS PROVIDE PERFORMANCES, DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF CURRICULA-SUPPORTING PLAYS/LITERATURE) VISITED 64 SCHOOLS AND ENGAGED 10,378 STUDENTS IN NINE OHIO COUNTIES. THE THEATER'S 33RD ANNUAL CLEVELAND METROPOLITAN SCHOOL DISTRICT "A CHRISTMAS CAROL" WRITING CONTEST ENGAGED AN ADDITIONAL 300 STUDENTS FROM 11 SCHOOLS. ALL 2021-2022 EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMMING WAS DELIVERED AMIDST PANDEMIC-DISRUPTION CHALLENGES.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART III, LINE 12, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: MISCELLANEOUS - 2017 AMOUNT: $ 10,012. 2018 AMOUNT: $ 2,934. 2019 AMOUNT: $ 20,620. 2020 AMOUNT: $ 4,881. 2021 AMOUNT: $ 22,372. EMPLOYEE RETENTION CREDIT - 2020 AMOUNT: $ 239,444. WORKERS COMPREFUNDS - 2020 AMOUNT: $ 26,233.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INTENDED USE OF ENDOWMENT FUNDS - ENDOWMENT FUND INCOME IS USED FOR GENERAL OPERATING SUPPORT.

INCOME TAX STATUS - GLT IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAX UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. GLT BELIEVES IT HAS APPROPRIATE SUPPORT FOR ANY TAX POSITIONS TAKEN AND, AS SUCH, DOES NOT HAVE ANY UNCERTAIN TAX PROVISIONS THAT WOULD BE MATERIAL TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. GLT'S FEDERAL TAX RETURNS ARE SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY THE IRS, GENERALLY FOR THREE YEARS AFTER THEY ARE FILED.
PLEDGES RECEIVABLE WRITTEN OFF INCLUDED IN DEVELOPMENT EXPENSE IN THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS 1,810.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DELEGATION OF BOARD AUTHORITY - AS PER ARTICLE V OF GLT'S CODE OF REGULATIONS, THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL, BETWEEN MEETINGS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, HAVE ALL THE AUTHORITY OF THE BOARD, INCLUDING THE AUTHORITY TO CREATE AND FILL VACANCIES ON THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE COMMITTEE ALSO RECRUITS AND HIRES THE ARTISTIC AND EXECUTIVE DIRECTORS. THE COMMITTEE MUST REGULARLY REPORT TO THE BOARD. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE CONSISTS OF THE ELECTED OFFICERS, THE CHAIR OF EACH STANDING COMMITTEE (5 COMMITTEES) AND SUCH NUMBER OF AT-LARGE MEMBERS AS APPOINTED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. SUCH AT-LARGE MEMBERS, OFFICERS, AND COMMITTEE CHAIRS ARE ELECTED BY THE BOARD AT ITS ANNUAL MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: REPORTABLE RELATIONSHIPS - NATALIE EPSTEIN AND HOWARD EPSTEIN HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: REVIEW OF FORM 990 - THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES HAS DELEGATED THE AUTHORITY TO REVIEW THE FORM 990 TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE. THIS COMMITTEE REVIEWS AND APPROVES FORM 990 BEFORE FILING AND AFTER IT HAS BEEN REVIEWED BY THE INDEPENDENT AUDITING FIRM PERFORMING THE ANNUAL AUDIT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MONITORING AND ENFORCEMENT OF CONFLICT POLICY - ALL TRUSTEES ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE AND SIGN ANNUAL DISCLOSURE FORMS ABOUT CONFLICTS. WHEN A CONFLICT ARISES, THE PERSON IS NOT PERMITTED TO PARTICIPATE IN THE DISCUSSION OR TO VOTE ON THE TRANSACTION. THE DECISION ABOUT THE TRANSACTION IS MADE BY PERSONS WHO ARE INDEPENDENT OF THE INDIVIDUAL WITH THE CONFLICT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION REVIEW AND APPROVAL - GREAT LAKES THEATER SUBSCRIBES TO AN ANNUAL SURVEY BY THEATER COMMUNICATIONG GROUP. SALARY RANGES FOR ALL EMPLOYEES FALL WITHIN THE NORMS OF THE GREAT LAKES THEATER'S BUDGET GROUP. COMPENSATION FOR THE TOP PAID EMPLOYEES IS NEGOTIATED BY THE BOARD PRESIDENT AND APPROVED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD. THE PRESIDENT AND COMMITTEE MEMBERS ARE INDEPENDENT OF THE EMPLOYEE FOR WHOM THE COMPENSATION DECISION IS BEING MADE. ACTORS AND OTHER UNION EMPLOYEES ARE PAID WITHIN CONTRACTUAL RANGES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AVAILABILITY OF DOCUMENTS - GREAT LAKES THEATER MAKES ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. IT DOES NOT MAKE ITS CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY OR GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.
ADJUSTMENT FOR PLEDGES RECEIVABLE WRITTEN OFF TO DEVELOPMENT EXPENSE -1,810.
